profile.about:
Computer Science at the University of Virginia. 

Interested in Full Stack Software Development and Machine Learning. Published and authored 2 papers on Machine Learning. Extensive experience with full stack development and object oriented programming. Experienced in C++, Java, and Python. 
A keen problem-solver and self-starter who is looking for internship opportunities in Tech Development & would love to contribute from my experience.

You can reach out to me at mb2mcc@virginia.edu
profile.name: Manish Balamurugan

nodes.company: Walsh Lab at the University of Virginia
Manbachi Lab at the Johns Hopkins University

nodes.description: Headed a Tech Startup designed to enhance the education and research pursuits of students throughout the US. Generated 3,000+ sign ups for the product's beta launch through coordinated social media campaigns.  Developed the application which featured standard networking functionality using Flutter and Firebase.
nodes.name: Hyphora

nodes.description: Utilized the YOLOv4 object detection system to develop a machine learning pipeline which can be utilized by neurosurgeons in real time to detect foreign bodies during surgical procedures with an accuracy of 61%. Developed this application utilizing SwiftUI and Firebase. Published with First Author credentials in the SPIE Medical Imaging Journal
nodes.name: Automatic detection of cotton balls during brain surgery where deep learning meets ultrasound imaging to tackle foreign objects

nodes.description: Utilized TensorFlow and Keras extensively to create a machine learning pipeline which was able to accurately reconstruct corrupted ultrasound images with an average reconstruction accuracy of 90%. Coordinated project design and implementation. Published in the Frontier of Biomedical Devices with First Author credentials.
nodes.name: Automatic detection of cotton balls during brain surgery where deep learning meets ultrasound imaging to tackle foreign objects
